data.title: BLACK FUTURE MONTH: Thur Feb 5, 7pm, Les Saignantes (The Bleeders) 2005, Adm. $6 – Black World Cinema
data.text:
Black World Cinema and Chatham 14 presents

an exploration of AfroFuturism, Black Radical Imagination and speculative realities.

Thursday, February 6, 7pm, Adm. $6

PROGRAM 1: AfroFutures

Les Saignantes (The Bleeders) 2005,

Cameroon, 92 min, Adult Content

Dir: Jean-Pierre Bekolo

Trailer: http://vimeo.com/117553282

#blackfuturemonth, #afrofuturism849

SMG Chatham 14

210 W 87th St, Chicago

Yaounde 2025 A.D. Two streetwise women are sent on a strange odyssey through a decaying society in this offbeat sci-fi comedy, set in a fictional African nation in the year 2025. Majolie (Adèle Ado) is an ambitious prostitute whose clients include a handful of prominent politicians, and one evening’s assignment with the secretary general of the Civil Cabinet (Balthazar Amadagoleda) becomes problematic when he dies in flagrante delicto. Needing to get rid of the body and fast, Majolie calls on her best friend, Chouchou (Dorylia Calmel), for help. Disposing of the secretary general’s remains sends Majolie and Chouchou on a strange ride through the sordid underbelly of the city as they discover a number of people looking for a way to turn the streetwalker’s poor fortune to their advantage, including a crooked politician, a Machiavellian taxi driver, a handful of street people, and an underground society of covertly powerful women.
